column4: To reach a sustainable future, every company must not supply goods or services which emit greenhouse gases as a direct consequence of their use.

This includes, but is not limited to: combustible fuels (e.g. diesel, coal); equipment powered by combustion (e.g. cars, ships); GHGs which are themselves sold as products (e.g. refrigerants); services whose provision causes GHG emissions (e.g. taxi rides, commercial flights); and manufactured products that contain GHGs which may be emitted during use or released post-use (e.g. air conditioners, refrigerators) and do not have a take-back or containment solution for those substances.
